body:
This will render rclone useless for downloading photos it didn't upload.

However it can still upload photos and download photos that it uploaded is my understanding.

I think this makes the backend still worth keeping but with even more caveats in the docs.

What do you think @philips ?
@ncw Yea, you are right. I guess there is some utility remaining. But, it is greatly reduced. I suppose just patching out the deprecated scopes and documenting it well is the best that can be done.

Experiencing an issue now where all images in `rclone mount` is 0 bytes ðŸ¤” (metadata looks correct other than filesize 0 bytes)
should I open a dedicated issue for it?

I have just started to experience this error `Request had insufficient authentication scopes. (403 PERMISSION_DENIED)` and I wonder if it is related to the scopes being dropped after the 31 of March.

I use the Google photos backend to upload photos and albums

I'm reading this while I'm in the middle of backing up my whole library. However, everything is still working fine under the `media/all` folder. I'm using my own API keys, not sure if that's relevant for this.

What a bummer if Google goes ahead with this with no possible exceptions/workarounds...

EDIT: [This issue](https://issuetracker.google.com/issues/368779600) is their 2nd most upvoted. I think we (rclone users) should go there and upvote (commenting it's useless) as much as possible to bring attention of how important it is to get this reverted.

@ncw Can that link be added to https://forum.rclone.org/t/fix-google-photos/47684/32 as well as a suggested solution in the meantime?

@ferferga 
> I'm reading this while I'm in the middle of backing up my whole library. However, everything is still working fine under the `media/all` folder. I'm using my own API keys, not sure if that's relevant for this.

It still appears to be working with rclone's main keys too. 

> EDIT: [This issue](https://issuetracker.google.com/issues/368779600) is their 2nd most upvoted. I think we (rclone users) should go there and upvote (commenting it's useless) as much as possible to bring attention of how important it is to get this reverted.

I did that. THere are lots of issues about the google photos API and I don't think google have every fixed any of them so don't hold your breath! I think the main problem is that google don't eat their own dogfood. By that I mean the Google Photos website does not use the Google Photos API so they really don't care about it. Its just a privacy and maintenance nightmare for them.

> Can that link be added to https://forum.rclone.org/t/fix-google-photos/47684/32 as well as a suggested solution in the meantime?

Is there a suggested solution?

When/if the API stops working, and if I ever have enough spare time, I'll expand `gphotosdl` so it uses the browser to incrementally downdload all the files

@ncw First of all, my bad, I meant [this thread](https://forum.rclone.org/t/add-the-new-google-photos-picker-api-to-rclone/47938), sorry for the confusion.

It's not a suggested solution per-se of course â€” Google seems to have retracted from those changes, but we don't know if they're just giving an extension (so sooner than later rclone will break). When that happens, people will come to the forum or docs looking for solutions, and I think that having those Google results ready before "the disaster" happens is better than having a bunch of users without an idea of why suddenly rclone stopped working.

Something along the lines of (which I believe is as neutral as it can be):

``
Google announced the Picker API, deprecating the old Library APIs that rclone uses on March 31st, 2025. That means that rclone will be unable to access photos from your library if they have not been uploaded with rclone. See [Google's 368779600 issue](https://issuetracker.google.com/issues/368779600)
``

This way users are aware of what's happening with much effort, plus they can voice their feedback if they wish in the original Google issue. I'm aware that Google doesn't care a lot about the API feedback, but it's also a pity that mostly only the `gphotos-sync` users "joined forces" and us, which are equally affected, aren't doing anything, mostly because of ignorance of this matter.

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/5ee4d4de-2835-4013-8a81-2974a8663b7c)

> If your app is uploading media items or creating albums, make sure your using the photoslibrary.appendonly scope, and not the photoslibrary scope. The photoslibrary scope is being removed.
Source: https://developers.google.com/photos/support/updates

Could the scope be updated to photoslibrary.appendonly & photoslibrary.edit.appcreateddata?

Edit: Or perhaps add an option to customize the scopes?

issue.title: gphotosdl ARMv5 - 32 Bit NOHF version

repository.name: gphotosdl
repository.description: This is a original resolution Google Photos downloader for use with rclone.

issue.body:
Hello and thank you for the precious tools.
Is it possible for you to compile an ARMv5 version just as the RClone to use it in an old QNAP Nas?
I managed to run RClone on the Nas but I would like to also have the gphotosdl to download the full size photos.
Can this work?
Thank you!
